With this move we enter in a well known opening trick: Black can try Bf5, in sight that after QxB, Qxb2 wins the rook. BUT white has Qc8#, black must defend, and is to be said whether white has compensation for the exchange.

Not now, at least, but the threat is still there. Now there is no mate on c8, so I have to think what to do against Bf5. The line e3 - Be3 doesn't work because after the exchange, Qxb2 has no compensation for me (I?ve played it successfully, though).
